subject: Re: [junit] JUnit & J2EE
msgSnippet: Hi George, I ve used JBuilder 3.X and VisualCafe The JBuilder environment is better integrated and has a smaller footprint. This is particularly important if
messageBody:
Hi George,

I've used JBuilder 3.X and VisualCafe
The JBuilder environment is better integrated and
has a smaller footprint. This is particularly
important if you're using DataStorage (JDataStore)
or CORBA (Visibroker). THe VisualCafe environment
had a bad habit or blue-screening on NT Workstation 4
SP 5.
IBM's IDE has been integrated with JUnit for some time

I believe the latest versions of JBuilder are also.
JUnit cannot help you make your decision but
if you expect to Unit test your work I highly
recommend it.

Cheers,
Mark

--- "Dinwiddie, George"
<George.Dinwiddie@...> wrote:
> I've been tasked with evaluating WebLogic/VisualCafe
> and
> Borland Application Server/JBuilder for J2EE
> development.
> Making it more difficult, I've not done J2EE
> development,
> so I have a bit of a learning curve to climb in a
> very
> short time. I'm thinking that JUnit might be able
> to
> help me accomplish this in the week I've been given.
>
> Can anyone give me any cheat-sheets for getting
> started
> very quickly? Also, any tips or feedback on these
> tools
> (or suggestions of others, perhaps) would be greatly
> appreciated.
>
> Thanks,
> George
>
>
>
